CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 3, reads: "Integrated Radio Car Crew Nabs Suspect - 80-Year-Old Man Slugged, Murdered By Bloomfield Thug in Broad Daylight - Find Body, Arrest Killer - Radio Car Patrolmen Charles B. Tarrant and Nicholas Radick of the East Liberty Police Station, were summoned to this alley beside the rear of the Cameraphone Theatre, East Liberty, Monday where they found the battered body of Green Evans, member of a well-known Garfield Hill business and professional family.  When witnesses said that they alleged killer, Walter Phillips (inset) had fled toward Shadyside and a police radio call said a man answering the description was molesting a woman on Spahr St., the responding officers arrested the killer within a few minutes.  Evans' wallet, containing $1.94, was in the suspect's hand when he was nabbed. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Radio car patrolmen Charles B. Tarrant and Nicholas Radick of the East Liberty Police Station posed in front of squad car
